section.title: Introduction
section.para: skillsOnCourse is a web site for tutors and students which allows them to interact with your college and with each other. Every student and tutor is automatically given a login when their record is created in onCourse or when they enrol online. skillsOnCourse has been optimised for mobile and touch pad devices, as well as desktop browsers.

skillsOnCourse gives tutors the information they need without having to contact you regularly. "Is my class full?", "Will my class go ahead?", "Can I get a class roll", "I need to get a message out to my students before the next session." These are all things that your teaching staff will ask you every day; now you have a 24 hour assistant to help tutors get the answers they need.

Students will also enjoy the skillsOnCourse portal. They can quickly and easily get the information they need about their classes and timetable, as well as interact with other students and their tutors.

section.title: Creating accounts and logging in
section.para: All students when they are created in onCourse, will automatically have a skillsOnCourse account set up for them. The first time a student enrols in your college, they will be sent an email which allows them to log into skillsOnCourse and set their password. Tutors are also given an account when their record is created in onCourse.

The skillsOnCourse login screen will prompt the student or tutor to enter their details. Like the onCourse enrolment process, a student is identified by name and email address to avoid forcing students and tutors remember another user id.

section.title: Recovering and Resetting Passwords
section.para: The main login screen for the skillsOnCourse portal includes a 'forgot password' link. The user will need to provide a name and valid email address in order to initiate the process. If the student or tutor does not have an email address in onCourse then they must contact the college so that you can manually update their record. It is important that you implement an appropriate set of policies around how to authenticate users over the phone when they request that their email address be changed or added, since that email address will give them access to the full profile and history of the user.

If the user clicks on the forgot password link and enters the other details, an email will be sent to them with a link to enable them create a new password. This link will be valid for 24 hours only, after that time the link within the email will not work. Once the student has reset their password, they can continue using skillsOnCourse.

para.programlisting:
Dear {name},
To reset your SkillsOnCourse password, simply click the link below. That will take you to a web page where you can create a new password. Please note that the link will expire 24 hours after this email was sent.
{recoveryLink}
If you weren't trying to reset your password, don't worry - your account is still secure and no one has been given access to it. Most likely, someone just mistyped their email address while trying to reset their own password.

section.title: Updating Your Details
section.para: Once logged in, users are able to update their contact details via the 'My Profile' menu. This screen also enables them to update their password and subscribe to receive marketing material via email SMS or post, as well as signing up to receive a regular newsletter.

section.para: If a student is undertaking an RTO Course, they can provide / update the required AVETMISS information via the profile page.

section.title: Navigating skillsOnCourse
section.para: Students and Tutors are able to navigate their way around skillsOnCourse via the left hand menu options. By clicking on the 'skillsOnCourse' logo in the top left hand corner of the page, they can return to the home page of the site. Because the site is built using modern html techniques, the user can safely use the back button on their browser or bookmark any page they like. When they return to a bookmarked page they will be asked to log in and will then be redirected to the page they bookmarked.

If a student or tutor is updating their profile, they must submit their changes before navigating away from that page. The same logic applies to any new posts / messages to the forum and if a student is submitting a rating for a given class. If they leave the page without saving the changes, those changes are lost.

section.title: Timetable Information
section.para: The user timetable can be viewed as either a list of sessions or as a month or calendar view. The timetable will display all classes on a given day, by clicking on a given day the session information will display at the bottom of the page, including course name, room, venue and tutor information. Timetables are applicable either to classes a student is enrolled in, or to sessions being taught by a tutor.

section.title: Discussion Forum
section.para: A discussion forum is available as a resource to class tutors and students. Each forum is specific to a given class and can be switched on or off by the College when the class is created within onCourse. The forum can also be set up to be automatically disabled a certain number of days after the class finished. This forum, which is moderated by the tutor, enables tutors and students to discuss, within a secure environment, all aspects of a given class.

All communication is visible to the entire class. Direct contact between students is not available for privacy and personal security reasons, and is not always appropriate in a shared learning environment. Should a student wish to contact another student privately they should exchange personal contact details outside of skillsOnCourse

caption.para: Discussion Forum - view of all current discussions

section.title: Create New Discussion Thread
section.para: Students and tutors are able to start a new discussion thread within a given forum. To do this simply click on the 'new discussion' link within the forum view of the skillsOnCourse portal. The new discussion page will then appear: simply select the class which you wish to create the discussion for, add a subject and a message as appropriate. Once this information is provided, click on 'Start New Discussion'.

caption.para: Discussion Forum - create new discussion

section.title: Add new Comment to Existing Discussion
section.para: Students and tutors are able to add new comments to an existing discussion thread. Tutors also have the ability to delete a comment or post which is deemed to be inappropriate. The comment is kept within the system (for legal reasons) but hidden from view.

section.title: Class information
section.para: Students can access up to date class information such as the date of the next session, venue and room information, download course materials in advance of the course, as well as receive course related messages from Tutors and fellow students.

Tutors can submit the course materials documents to the College in advance of the class in order for them to be made available to students. Class materials will be uploaded by College staff via the onCourse client as attachments (PDF is the best format for ease of use on many systems) and flagged as 'web visible (private)'. Both tutors and students will be able to access and download these PDF documents from skillsOnCourse. At this stage it is not possible for tutors to directly upload attachments for their class, since the college needs to review content to ensure it is appropriate and has the appropriate copyright clearance.

section.title: Getting Directions to a Classroom
section.para: The skillsOnCourse class detail view provides a link to Google maps, providing detailed directions for getting to the venue.

section.title: Tutor Specific Features
section.para: Some features are only visible to tutors, including real time marking of the attendance roll for a given class.

section.title: Viewing and Marking a Class Roll
section.para: Tutors can access the attendance roll for the class they are teaching, updating the attendance records in real time. As skillsOnCourse is enabled for mobile devices and touch pads, this makes it even simpler to update attendance rolls in real time. The attendance roll can also list contact details such as mobile and email addresses for students, allowing the tutor to easily contact students who have not shown up for their scheduled classes.

caption.para: Live attendance tracking via the skillsOnCourse portal
Live attendance tracking can also be done via the mobile site

section.title: Moderating forums
section.para: The tutor has the ability to moderate content and remove any posts that are deemed to be off-topic or inappropriate.

section.title: Approving Class Information
section.para: Class tutors have the ability to sign off course and class content. There is also a dialog box available to the tutor so they can send in comments and or suggested amendments to the course copy. College staff then approve and update the changes via the onCourse client. Tutors cannot edit the course schedule or description themselves, since it needs to be properly approved by College staff.

caption.para: Tutors can amend and approve class content
Tutors can also send approval for class content via the mobile site

section.title: Viewing of Survey Results
section.para: Once a student completes the survey, the tutor is able to view those results. This provides the tutor with an overall average of ranking results for tutor, course and venue for a given class or classes. As well as giving the tutor the ability to review all comments posted by the students. The comments are may be anonymously by a student, in which case there is nothing which identifies which student made a particular comment.

caption.para: Summary view of completed surveys for tutor
Summary view of completed surveys via the mobile site

section.title: Student Specific Features
section.para: Students have their own feature set, including the ability to update their account details, access forums and message boards, as well as complete an online survey for a class that they have completed. It is also an invaluable resource for accessing and downloading class materials in advance of a given class.

If a student enrols in a class that has an online forum, the College will specify the amount of time students within that class will have access to that forum after the completion of the class. If for example the tutor wishes to send the students additional information and or continue with a discussion, the forum can remain open to allow that communication to take place.
The skillsOnCourse account will remain open for the student to access indefinitely, even if a forum is no longer available to the student.

section.title: Rating Classes
section.para: Class students will now have the ability to provide a 'rating' for the class they have completed. This rating is based upon three key criteria, tutor, course and venue. The student simply selects the number of stars to be given to each of these criteria.

Students can provide a written comment within this survey function. The student can decide whether the comment can be published by the College for use in future marketing activity such as testimonials. The survey screen will include a brief statement asking the student to confirm if they want their comment to be made publicly available, they give their consent via a tick box on screen. The student has the further ability to post an 'anonymous' comment or be identified by their first name and initial of surname.

caption.para: Students can rate classes by content, tutor and venue
Students can complete the survey via the mobile site

section.title: Contributing to Class Forums
section.para: If a student enrols in a class that has an online forum, they are able to participate in that forum, by either adding comments to an existing discussion thread or by adding a new discussion thread within the forum. As the tutor is the overall moderator of the forum, it is only them (and not the student) who can delete comments that are deemed inappropriate.
The class forum can remain open after a class has been completed, if the students of the class and the tutor want to continue their online communications.

section.title: Guide to Managing the skillsOnCourse for college staff
section.para: skillsOnCourse provides a range of new functionality for college staff, providing a number of improvements to communication methods between students and college staff, as well as between college staff and their tutors

section.title: Uploading of PDF Documents
section.para: College staff will be able to upload a PDF document or other documents via the class or course edit window of onCourse. Each attachment can be flagged as 'web visible (private)' in order to make it visible only to student enrolled in the class. Setting the attachment as 'web visible (public)' means that it is visible to everyone browsing the main college website. Use this option for things students will need before making a decision to enrol.

section.title: Creation of Forums for Classes
section.para: The College will have the ability to nominate as to whether a forum is appropriate for a given class, as not all classes will require a forum. This configuration is managed within the class edit window of onCourse.

section.title: New Reporting Functionality for Class Surveys
section.para: New reports are available in onCourse to provide summary and detailed views of all class survey results. As the survey itself is based upon the three key parameters of rating the tutor, course and venue, this provides Colleges with a much greater level of analysis of classes across all types and subjects. It also provides the College with access to invaluable testimonials and comments from students, if the student has given their approval for their comments to be published.
